summary: Stops running after a few minutes

description: What doesn't work - the CIDR method returns every ip address in the range wheather there is a host there or not. During the first time through this process the app crashed. I looked at the log and manually updated all packages that the crash report said were outdated and it does not seem to crash anymore. When I specify the ip range with addresses, it seems to return just the active hosts. yea! I could not use fingerprinting (-O) without dropping to the console and running it with sudo so if you are wanting to id the OS and you have to run the terminal anyway, you might as well just send nmap to a txt file with "sudo nmap -sT -O [range] > nmap-results.txt" then gedit nmap-results.txt or something like that. That said, if you dont care about that info then it works on ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
summary: mostly works but a bit confusing
